message_1: In how many ways can we choose 3 items from a set of 7 distinct items?
message_2:
To choose 3 items from a set of 7 distinct items, we can use the combination formula, which is:

C(n, k) = n! / (k!(n-k)!)

where n is the total number of items (7 in this case) and k is the number of items to choose (3 in this case). The exclamation mark denotes the factorial of a number.

C(7, 3) = 7! / (3!(7-3)!)

C(7, 3) = 7! / (3!4!)

C(7, 3) = (7 × 6 × 5 × 4 × 3 × 2 × 1) / ((3 × 2 × 1)(4 × 3 × 2 × 1))

C(7, 3) = (7 × 6 × 5) / (3 × 2 × 1)

C(7, 3) = 210 / 6

C(7, 3) = 35

So, there are 35 ways to choose 3 items from a set of 7 distinct items.
